Reference

All functions

add_icgc_metadata()

Layer on ICGC metadata from a supplemental table to fill in missing COO

annotate_hotspots()

Annotate MAF-like data frome with a hot_spot column indicating recurrent mutations

annotate_sv()

Annotate a data frame of SV breakpoints after retrieval from the database

append_to_table()

Title

ashm_multi_rainbow_plot()

Generate a colourful multi-panel overview of hypermutation in regions of interest across many samples

ashm_rainbow_plot()

Make a rainbow plot of all mutations in a region, ordered and coloured by metadata

assemble_file_details()

Title

assign_cn_to_ssm()

Annotate mutations with their copy number information

collate_ashm_results()

Determine the hypermutation status of a few genes

collate_curated_sv_results()

Collate all SV calls from the genome data and summarize for main oncogenes of interest per sample

collate_derived_results()

Extract derived results stored in the database (these are usually slower to derive on the fly)

collate_nfkbiz_results()

Determine which cases have NFKBIZ UTR mutations

collate_results()

Bring together all derived sample-level results from many GAMBL pipelines

collate_sbs_results()

Bring in the results from mutational signature analysis

collate_sv_results()

Determine and summarize which cases have specific oncogene SVs

copy_number_vaf_plot()

Create a genome-wide copy number plot for one sample and (optionally) display mutation VAF

fetch_output_files()

Title

finalize_study()

Finish setting up a new cBioPortal instance or updating an existing portal data set

find_files_extract_wildcards()

Title

fread_maf()

Title

get_ashm_count_matrix()

Title

get_bams()

Get full paths for bam files for a sample or patient

get_cn_segments()

Retrieve all copy number segments from the GAMBL database that overlap with a single genomic coordinate range

get_cn_states()

Get a copy number matrix for all samples based on segmented data in database

get_coding_ssm()

Retrieve all coding SSMs from the GAMBL database in MAF-like format

get_gambl_colours()

Get some colour schemes for annotating figures

get_gambl_metadata()

Get GAMBL metadata

get_gambl_outcomes()

Get the patient-centric clinical metadata

get_gene_cn_and_expression()

Get the copy number and expression for a single gene

get_gene_expression()

Get the expression for one or more genes for all GAMBL samples

get_manta_sv()

Retrieve Manta SVs from the database and filter

get_ssm_by_gene()

Get all somatic mutations for a given gene or list of genes and optionally restrict to coding variants

get_ssm_by_region()

Retrieve all SSMs from the GAMBL database within a single genomic coordinate range

get_ssm_by_regions()

Title

liftover_bedpe()

Use liftOver to convert a bedpe file between the two main genome builds (grch37/hg38)

maf_to_custom_track()

Convert a maf-formatted data frame into a bed custom track file for UCSC

make_igv_snapshot()

Load bams and generate an IGV screenshot for one or more regions

plot_multi_timepoint()

Title

populate_each_tool_result()

Title

populate_tool_results()

Populate the database with the per-sample summarized results of various tools

prettyChromoplot()

Use GISTIC2.0 scores output to reproduce maftools::chromoplot with more flexibility

prettyOncoplot()

Make an oncoplot that is pretty using ComplexHeatmap. The metadata is expected to follow the structure and column naming used in GAMBL. If you provide your own non-GAMBL samples and metadata, you must include at least the following columns with these names. The first one should match the Tumor_Sample_Barcode in the MAF object or onco_matrix you provide. sample_id, pathology

process_all_manta_bedpe()

This is a helper function that is not meant to be used routinely

read_merge_manta_with_liftover()

This is a helper function that is not meant to be used routinely

referesh_metadata_tables()

Title

refresh_full_table()

Title

sanitize_maf_data()

Write an oncomatrix from a MAF File for further plotting. This is meant to be run by individuals who have access to data sets to "sanitize" a subset of data for subsequent use by them or others who don't have permission to access the raw data. Example: User J has full permissions for ICGC data and has read permissions on a MAF file. User B needs to make some oncoplots and/or perform some statistical analysis on the frequency and assortment of mutations in that data set but doesn't need all the details. User J can run this function on a maf file and provide the path of the output to user B.

setup_fusions()

Annotate SVs and create the input for fusions to be displayed in cBioPortal instance

setup_study()

Initialize a new cBioPortal instance or update existing portal data set

sv_to_custom_track()

Title
